wikipedia_page.main: Ian Newton  (born  17 January 1940) is an English ornithologist.

response: It waits, hidden, for birds to come near, then breaks cover and flies out fast and low. A chase may follow, with the hawk even flipping upside-down to grab the victim from below or following it on foot through vegetation. It can "stoop" onto prey from a great height.
